results.title: The Fight game
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: A survey of boxing from the days when the rules were first formalised, to the present use of boxing by groups working wiht boys to give them healthful recreation and to channel their energies away from socially destructive practices. Includes scenes of Gane, Nelson, Dempsey, Tunney and Louis. The film closes with an examination of racketeering and other ills afflicting the sport and their possible cure.

results.title: Fight for better schools
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: How one American locality took up the fight for better schools. Statistics point to the general problems faced by America, which are exemplified by conditions in Arlington County, Virginia. Citizens there who became alive to the weaknesses of the local education system met only indifference until they showed the overcrowding and lack of facilities. Their action led to the election of new committees, new schools, new facilities and programs, and better pay for teachers.

results.title: Fashion means business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
This film highlights the fashion industry in America. Top designers in New York and Paris are shown at work and a survey of America’s garment district gives some idea of the enormous size of the industry.

results.title: The Family: an approach to peace
results.brief_description: Shows that the only way to peace is in the understanding of other peoples, and contrasts the popular conception of foreign lands with life as it actually is around the globe. Through scenes of everyday family life everywhere, describes the similarity of the fears and aspirations of all people.

results.title: The F.B.I.
results.creator_credit: Fortune Films, Time Inc and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the 24-hour-a-day vigilance of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the techniques and crime detection methods shown at the F.B.I. laboratories, and the rigorous training an agent must undergo. Dramatizes the case of the Nazi spy, August Baumeyer, and illustrates the effectiveness of counter-espionage by the F.B.I. Features F.B.I. Director, John Edgar Hoover.

results.title: Careers for girls
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Productions, Forum Films and March of Time
results.brief_description: This segment, produced as part of ‘The March of Time’ newsreel and documentary series, provides general career advice for young women in post-WWII America. The suggested career paths are reflective of the late 1940s, focusing on areas such as office work, nursing, fashion and retail. But rather than restrict the options to these areas, career advancement and less traditional career paths, like science and medicine, are addressed. Pointers on how to find a job matched to your personality are interspersed with successful women in each particular field. ‘The March of Time’ series was produced between 1935 and 1951 and, whilst a very popular series, failed to make money due to high production costs.

results.title: Battle for bread
results.creator_credit: Richard De Rochemont, March of Time, Inc. and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: The film stresses the importance of food in a world that has never produced enough for everyone, and describes the efforts of FAO to stimulate food production in many countries. After a preliminary survey of the food problem in war-torn countries, the film describes the working of the FAO program; agricultural machinery to China, international conferences on poison sprays for insects, the fight against animal diseases, encouragement to farmers to grow new kinds of crops.

results.title: The American teacher
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Yesterday’s education in the United States was typified by the proverbial Little Red School House and today’s (1947) emphasis is upon the scientific principles of psychology - but all good teachers know that their methods are as individualistic and personal as any other artist’s; all realise the importance of developing in their pupils the ability to think as well as a knowledge of the facts. The film presents the pros and cons of “progressive education” and points out to the American citizen their responsibility for the quality of the education the community provides for its young.

results.title: America's traffic problem
results.brief_description: Presents the national traffic problem created by an automotive age, and shows some of the solutions which have been put into effect to alleviate the situation. Far-sighted educators know that a partial solution to the traffic dilemma is the training of young people in good driving techniques. No other credits available.
